channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KY

item.title: Report X-2024030372
item.description:
Report X-2024030372

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-12T15:28:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-06
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA was called to a leaking hazmat, when admin arrived package was already in a lined tote with a large puddle of product on the floor from where it had been leaking. Spill pads were used to clean up large quantity of spilled product then neutralizer was used over top of spill. After neutralizer sat for a minute it was swept up. DescribePack: Body of hard plastic bag inside of fiberboard box looked as if a side seam burst due to impact with the floor or another hard object. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was kept in a lined tote in an upright postion.

item.title: Report X-2024030143
item.description:
Report X-2024030143

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-11T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-06
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A WET PACKAGE THAT WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH AND HAD A SMALL AMOUNT OF DRY ICE VAPOR COMING FROM THE BOTTOM CORNER OF THE BOX. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY 40 LBS OF DRY ICE PELLETS COOLING TWO BIOHAZARD BAGS CONTAINING SPECIMENS. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS BEING SHIPPED IN THE AIR NETWORK. THERE IS A RUSH, PERISHABLE INSULATED STICKER AFFIXED TO ONE SIDE OF THE BOX. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM MARYLAND USING THE CONSIGNEE UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 442F01, AXIS CLINICALS, 1711 CENTER AVE W, DILWORTH MN 56529-1342.

item.title: Report X-2024021578
item.description:
Report X-2024021578

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-06T18:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-22
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: X-2024021578: AT THE UPS WORLDPORT FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KY, AN AIR PACKAGE FROM UNITED KINGDOM TO OKLAHOMA, USA WAS INSPECTED DUE TO PREVIOUS UNDECLARED SHIPMENTS BEING FOUND BY USA CBP AGENTS. PACKAGE INSPECTION REVEALS MEAL, READY TO EAT (MRE) WITH FLAMELESS RATION HEATERS CONTAINING MAGNESIUM POWDER, CARBON CLASSIFIED AS DANGEROUS WHEN WET. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE WAS IMPORTED FROM THE UNITED KINGDOM USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER [PII REMOVED] WELWYM GARDEN C, AL74FH, UNITED KINGDOM. X-2024021584: AT THE UPS WORLDPORT FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KY, AN AIR PACKAGE FROM UNITED KINGDOM TO ALASKA, USA WAS INSPECTED DUE TO PREVIOUS UNDECLARED SHIPMENTS BEING FOUND BY USA CBP AGENTS. PACKAGE INSPECTION REVEALS MEAL, READY TO EAT (MRE) WITH FLAMELESS RATION HEATERS CONTAINING MAGNESIUM POWDER, CARBON CLASSIFIED AS DANGEROUS WHEN WET. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE WAS IMPORTED FROM THE UNITED KINGDOM USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER [PII REMOVED] WELWYM GARDEN C, AL74FH, UNITED KINGDOM.

item.title: Report X-2024021754
item.description:
Report X-2024021754

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-06T18:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-08
  • City: SHEPHERDSVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: When we received the package it was found spilling little beads from one side of the box . We took the cylinder out of the box and put it in a non spill tote to further inspect it DescribePack: When we opened the package, we inspected all sides of the cylinder to see where the release was coming from. We shook and tapped the package to find exactly where it was coming from, come to find out there was a small crack on the bottom of the cylinder about 2-3 inches long. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: To mitigate the effects of the release, we taped the bottom of the package and it in a non spill tote.

item.title: Report X-2024021588
item.description:
Report X-2024021588

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-06T18:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-22
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: AT THE UPS WORLDPORT FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KY AN AIR PACKAGE WAS FOUND LEAKING. RESPONDER INSPECTED CONTENTS TO FIND THE SOURCE OF THE LEAK TO BE ONE GALLON OF EPOXYSTARZ EXPERT GRADE METALLIC EPOXY SYSTEM, PART B WITH GHS PICTOGRAMS ON THE CONTAINER. THE CONTAINER LEAKED DUE TO HAVING A POOR SEAL AROUND THE TOP FROM A WARPED LID. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE A REGULATED DANGEROUS GOODS WAS BEING SHIPPED IN THE AIR SERVICE. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM ILLINOIS USING UPS ACCOUNT 0VE277, SN CONSOLIDATION, 193 LAUREL FOREST CIRCLE, ATLANTA GA 30342.

item.title: Report X-2024021833
item.description:
Report X-2024021833

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-06T18:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-25
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A package handler dropped the 55 pound package causing the bottom of the 5 gallon bucket inside of the box to crack. QA was notified and we swept up the oxidizer. We secured the package and soiled contents in a lined red tote. DescribePack: Package was dropped DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a lined red tote.

item.title: Report X-2024021619
item.description:
Report X-2024021619

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-06T18:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-22
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A LEAKING DANGEROUS GOODS PACKAGE MARKED AND LABELED AS CONSUMER COMMODITY ID8000 WITH A CLASS 9 DIAMOND LABEL, AIR LIMITED QUANTITY MARKING AND SHIPPERS DECLARATION. THE DANGEROUS GOODS SHIPMENT HAD PREVIOUSLY PASSED AN ACCEPTANCE AUDIT AT THE ORIGIN FACILITY. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED ONE 200 ML CONTAINER OF RITUALS FOAMING SHOWER GEL WITH A BROKEN LID THAT WAS LEAKING. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM THE NETHERLANDS GOING TO THE USA USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER B567JO, ARVATO BENELUX BV, BREM 1, HEIJEN NETHERLANDS 6598MH.
